title: Rodjun Cruz
text:
Rodolfo Othello Cruz Ilustre, Jr. (born October 10, 1987), known professionally as Rodjun Cruz, is a <a href="Filipino%20people">Filipino</a> <a href="actor">actor</a>, <a href="dance">dance</a>r and <a href="Singing">singer</a>. He is the brother of fellow actor and dancer <a href="Rayver%20Cruz">Rayver Cruz</a>.
Biography.
Cruz started as a host, together with his younger brother Rayver, in the children's magazine show "5 And Up". Cruz was a member of the now defunct all-male dancing group Anim-E. The group, previously named Anime—in reference to the <a href="Tagalog%20language">Tagalog</a> word ""anim" or "six""—originally consisted six members namely: <a href="Rayver%20Cruz">Rayver Cruz</a>, <a href="John%20Wayne%20Sace">John Wayne Sace</a>, <a href="Emman%20Abeleda">Emman Abeleda</a>, <a href="Sergio%20Garcia%20%28actor%29">Sergio Garcia</a>, <a href="Mico%20Aytona">Mico Aytona</a>, and <a href="Mhyco%20Aquino">Mhyco Aquino</a>. Rodjun joined the original members in 2005.
In 2006, he was cast as Jigo in the <a href="ABS-CBN">ABS-CBN</a> TV series "<a href="Calla%20Lily%20%28TV%20series%29">Calla Lily</a>".
After a year, Cruz along with 14 other celebrity contestants joined the second season of "<a href="U%20Can%20Dance">U Can Dance Version 2</a>", where he met and started dating fellow Star Magic talent <a href="Dianne%20Medina">Dianne Medina</a>. Cruz with his dancing partner Lina Basas were named Grand Champion of U Can Dance Version 2 the following year, where he won the grand prize of 250,000 pesos. He also won another 250,000 pesos from the "Merrygalo" segment of, the now defunct noontime variety show, "<a href="Wowowee">Wowowee</a>". He made a guest appearance in the "Mambabarang" episode of "<a href="Komiks%20%28TV%20series%29">Komiks</a> Presents: <a href="Pedro%20Penduko%20at%20ang%20mga%20Engkantao">Pedro Penduko at ang mga Engkantao</a>" in the same year.
In 2008, Cruz was cast as Jake Perez in the <a href="teen%20drama">teen drama</a> "<a href="Lipgloss%20%28TV%20series%29">Lipgloss</a>".
Cruz left Lipgloss after three seasons in 2009. He had minor roles in the <a href="ABS-CBN%20Corporation">ABS-CBN</a> shows "<a href="Tayong%20Dalawa">Tayong Dalawa</a>" and "<a href="May%20Bukas%20Pa%20%282009%20TV%20series%29">May Bukas Pa</a>". He also made guest appearances in "<a href="Maynila%20%28TV%20series%29">Maynila</a>" and "<a href="Midnight%20DJ">Midnight DJ</a>".
He played Calvin in "<a href="Magkaribal">Magkaribal</a>" in 2010. He was also cast as Joaquin Buenaventura in "<a href="Juanita%20Banana">Juanita Banana</a>". The same year, he left "<a href="ASAP%20%28variety%20show%29">ASAP XV</a>" and joined, the show's rival, P.O.5 in <a href="Associated%20Broadcasting%20Company">TV5</a>.
Personal life.
Cruz is a cousin of entertainers <a href="Sheryl%20Cruz">Sheryl Cruz</a>, <a href="Sunshine%20Cruz">Sunshine Cruz</a>, <a href="Geneva%20Cruz">Geneva Cruz</a> and <a href="Donna%20Cruz">Donna Cruz</a>.
In October 2017, Cruz announced his engagement to actress <a href="Dianne%20Medina">Dianne Medina</a> after dating since July 23, 2007. The couple married on December 21, 2019. On April 2020, they announced that they were expecting their first child together.
